thread.title: Briefs: UNH women fall in OT to Maine
thread.title_full: Briefs: UNH women fall in OT to Maine

title: Briefs: UNH women fall in OT to Maine
text: Briefs: UNH women fall in OT to Maine fosters.com Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 10:31 PM Updated Oct 15, 2015 at 10:50 PM Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 10:31 PM Updated Oct 15, 2015 at 10:50 PM DURHAM — Sophomore Brooke Murphy scored her 11th goal on the season but the University of New Hampshire women's soccer team fell 2-1 to the University of Maine in overtime, Thursday night at Bremner Field. The Wildcats dropped to 6-7-3 overall and 4-2-0 in conference. The Black Bears improved their record to 8-5-1 overall and 3-1-1 in conference to creep higher in the standings for the home playoff positions. College Basketball UNH men's Blue-White game on Oct. 21 DURHAM — The University of New Hampshire men's basketball team is set to play its Blue-White Game on Wednesday, Oct. 21, at Lundholm Gymnasium (7 p.m.). It will mark the first opportunity for fans to see the Wildcats in action this season. New Hampshire will play four eight-minute quarters in front of its fans before the regular season kicks off Friday, Nov. 13 (7:30 p.m.) against Lyndon State College in Durham. Field Hockey Marshwood hosts Gorham today SOUTH BERWICK, Maine — The No. 6 Marshwood High School field hockey team (10-3-1) will host No. 11 Gorham (4-9-1) today at 3 p.m. in the first round of the Southern Maine Class A tournament. The Hawks beat Gorham, 3-0, during the regular season on Sept. 18. The winner will play Wednesday in the quarters at No. 3 Thornton Academy (12-2-0), TBD. — Staff Reports Baseball Raimondo concerned PawSox are interested in Massachusetts PROVIDENCE, R.I. — Rhode Island Gov. Gina Raimondo says she's concerned the owners of the Pawtucket Red Sox are talking to officials in Massachusetts about the possibility of moving the minor league baseball team to the Bay State. The Democratic governor said Thursday she wants the Pawtucket-based team to stay in Rhode Island. The team recently ended its pursuit of waterfront land in downtown Providence for a new stadium. Mayor Domenic Sarno told The Republican he could envision a stadium for the Triple-A franchise in Springfield. He said there have been initial talks, which included PawSox co-owner Larry Lucchino. Raimondo says Providence officials are working with the PawSox to find an alternative site in Providence. She says she doesn't know if they're focused on a specific location. NBA James to sit out rest of preseason CLEVELAND — Cavaliers coach David Blatt said Thursday that LeBron James might not play for the remainder of Cleveland's exhibition season. James sat out his second straight game against Indiana after not playing Tuesday against Atlanta. The four-time MVP is healthy, but the Cavaliers want to limit his minutes in the preseason. James has played in two of the five preseason games. — The Associated Press
